pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8106649586/job/22156911350)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8106649586/job/22156911141)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8106649586/job/22156911253)
I think this is a nice addition, but left two small notes.
I think this is a nice addition, but left two small notes.

Putting these as part of the same `simp` call in which all the other lemmas are called could have some unwanted side effects. For example, this fails because we also call `mul_add`:
```
example (h : a * (b + c) = 0) : a * (b + c) = 0 := by
  noncomm_ring [h] -- fails
```
In noncommutative rings, you're much more likely (than in the commutative setting) to have equalities like `h` which would be otherwise simplified by the simp lemmas in `noncomm_ring`.

EDIT: I realized that the solution to this is actually not on the part of `noncomm_ring`, but rather on the user to write `noncomm_ring [↓h]`, which works. But maybe we could add this to the tactic's documentation, as I suspect most people aren't aware of `↓` yet.

I think it's reasonable for your example to fail. If you want to rewrite with `h` first we already can do that: `rw [h]; noncomm_ring`. The syntax `noncomm_ring [h]` is for cases where you  want to normalize, then rewrite, and perhaps then normalize further.
The proof that prompted me to implement this was something like `noncomm_ring; rw [h1, h2]; noncomm_ring; rw [h1]; noncomm_ring` and it felt tedious.

I'm ever so slightly concerned that this will make things slow because we'll be calling `abel` multiple times, but perhaps this concern is overblown because in practice it won't happen enough times to matter.

I agree that this is not the most efficient implementation. For this reason I made sure that `noncomm_ring` without arguments will not use `repeat`. I think that `noncomm_ring` with arguments will be exceedingly rare that it should not be an issue.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: allow adding extra lemmas to noncomm_ring tactic
